[ U ] great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain: endure torment The family said they had endured years of torment and abuse at the hands of their neighbours. Waiting for the result of the medical tests was sheer torment.in torment He spent the night in torment, trying to decide what was the best thing to do. torments [ plural ]
great mental suffering and unhappiness: go through torments Nothing can describe the torments we went through while we were waiting for news.
See more
[ C ] something or someone that causes great suffering or anger: torment to Writing reports was a monthly torment to him.
